alert.note: Alert for McCreary; Whitley (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 18 at 5:56AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of eastern McCreary and southwestern Whitley Counties through 630 AM EDT... At 555 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Beulah Heights, or near Whitley City, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Whitley City, Cumberland Falls S.P. and Stearns around 600 AM EDT. Pine Knot around 605 AM EDT. Duckrun, Bounty, Redbird and Krupp around 610 AM EDT. Jellico Creek, Hollyhill and Bon around 615 AM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Ayers, Zion Hill, Pleasant View, Emlyn, Saxton and Mountain Ash. THIS INCLUDES Interstate 75 in east central Kentucky between mile markers 3 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
